ygData.subject: RE: Lambent bits and pieces
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve tried this both ways. Used my invis song, got attacked by a shaman. Someone cast see invis and invis on me and a friend for corpse recovery, and I got
ygData.messageBody:
I've tried this both ways. Used my invis song, got attacked by a shaman.
Someone cast see invis and invis on me and a friend for corpse recovery, and
I got attacked still. After 5 deaths, I've made my way back to Rathe
Mountains and now Cazic Thule. =P

Sounds like people are having mixed experiences, but I travelled with 2
level 30's. One was a dwarf, but I think they're factions are good in Sol A.
The other was a level 30 Erudite Wizard, who calmly walked past a wizard who
blasted me to smithereens. He's been able to walk through that room before
without getting aggro'd on, so maybe it's just me?

---Windleaf

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Lonnie Lewis [mailto:LLewis@...]
> Sent: Thursday, February 10, 2000 11:24 AM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Lambent bits and pieces
>
>
> From: Lonnie Lewis <LLewis@...>
>
> were you doing the invis?

> > > Strange. Then why don't they aggro on other invis level
> 30's that I've
> > > travelled with. They're always baffled as to why these
> things aggro on
> > me
> > > and not them, or is this just a hate thing? *shrug*
> > >
> > > I'm a level 28 half-elf bard.
> >
> > I had the exact thing happen at L35 with my bard. 4 of us in Sol A.
> > Everyone invis's up and heads in. Every time, a goblin
> agro'd on me. I
> > tried twice walking behind everyone else and it always happened.
> > Everyone else would pass the goblin that attacked me.
> >
> >
